holidays.name: International Pillow Fight Day
holidays.description: A globally coordinated pillow fight extravaganza where people of all ages grab their fluffiest pillows and meet in public spaces for a massive, playful pillow brawl!
holidays.origin: Started in 2008 by a group of friends in Seattle who wanted to turn an everyday object into a weapon of joy and release some stress.
holidays.funFact: Sometimes, these pillow fights draw thousands of participants worldwide, turning entire cities into soft battlegrounds!

holidays.name: World Autism Awareness Day
holidays.description: An official United Nations observance aimed at increasing understanding and acceptance of people with autism, encouraging early diagnosis and support.
holidays.origin: Established by the UN in 2007 to raise awareness worldwide about autism and to promote inclusivity.
holidays.funFact: Many landmarks around the globe light up in blue on this day as part of the 'Light It Up Blue' campaign.

holidays.name: National Peanut Butter and Jelly Day (USA)
holidays.description: A celebration of the iconic sandwich staple that has delighted taste buds and lunchboxes for generations.
holidays.origin: Origin unknown, but peanut butter and jelly sandwiches became popular in the early 1900s in America, and this day honors their delicious combo.
holidays.funFact: Peanut butter and jelly sandwiches are so beloved that more than 6 million of them are eaten every day in the U.S.!

holidays.name: World Party Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to worldwide simultaneous partying — the idea is that everyone should dance, have fun, and unite in joy on the same day.
holidays.origin: Started by artist Josh Harris in 2004 to promote peace and happiness through synchronized celebrations across the planet.
holidays.funFact: On World Party Day, people try to synchronize their celebrations despite different time zones, creating a 24-hour global party.
